achieva credit union has become the first of its kind in florida to allow customers to purchase bitcoin.
customer curiosity for bitcoin rose once the credit union allowed thirdparty services to enable bitcoin purchases.
floridabased achieva credit union became the first credit union to offer customers the ability to buy and sell bitcoin through a new app according to a report from the tampa bay times.
the app reportedly went live this past tuesday through a partnership with bitcoin bank nydig which specializes in connecting traditional financial infrastructure to the bitcoin ecosystem.
previously achieva customers were only capable of making bitcoin trades through thirdparty applications.
in fact in the past year achieva watched as 26 million of thirdparty bitcoin transactions took place according to ingram.

how does it all work ’ ” prior to the release of the new app the credit union reportedly gave 10 to each of its employees to buy bitcoin for educational purposes both personally and for a training exercise in the application.
transactions with bitcoin on the application will incur a 2 service fee and achieva made it very clear that bitcoin deposits are not backed up or insured by the national credit union administration.
and its value is based on the price information collected from the outside using the chainlink oracle.
